VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Protect Personal Identifiable Information during Order Confirmation for Guest Buyers

If your storefront allows a guest buyer to check out, optionally ensure that a guest buyer's personal identifiable information (PII) doesn't display on the Order Confirmation page.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: In previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce, the Order Confirmation section of the Checkout page showed a guest buyer's PII by default, including:

The shipping and billing addresses used for the order
The guest buyer's email and phone number
The products purchased in the order and the buyer's entitled prices

Now, you can specify whether you want to prevent this information from displaying on the page. The Checkout module in the storefront configuration settings includes a new configuration, Display Guest Confirmation Information (co.cnfdsplguestinfo):

When this configuration is TRUE, the Order Confirmation section continues to show the guest buyer's PII, as previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce have done.
When this configuration is FALSE, the Order Confirmation section shows only the guest buyer's order number and the email address used for placing the order. The Order Confirmation email sent to the guest buyer's email still includes all the PII.

How: After you upgrade the managed package and upgrade the available global settings, the Display Guest Confirmation Information configuration is available and set to FALSE by default.

To continue showing a guest buyer's PII in the Order Confirmation section of the Checkout page, change this configuration to TRUE.

NOTE This change also adds CC Page Label records for new text shown in the Order Confirmation section when Display Guest Confirmation Information is FALSE. After you upgrade, ensure that you refresh the page label cache so that your storefront uses the new page labels.
